pros: Great friends were made there. A great jumping off point after college with plenty of responsibilities.

review_title: Good, but the reasons to work here are not financial...
pros: Hard, but rewarding work Very flexible schedules! I have control of my classes. Good culture and collab within department
cons: Non-profit org in Higher Ed = tenuous financial situation Not great communication between Admin and Faculty Mediocre health benefits Pay is just OK... not amazing, not terrible.

pros: Room was provided as a college student. Had weekends off. Got to learn some new skills along the way
cons: Some of the jobs like painting were very boring and hard to stick with for long periods of time.

pros: Flexible schedule and great bosses!
cons: None that I have experienced.

pros:
Close knit faculty and staff who love the university and the mission. 
Great student body. 
Quality academics.
cons:
No direction. 
Administration and Board of Trustees tied to Christian Nationalism and MAGA thinking. Willing to sacrifice employees to please donors. 
Very few perks. Very low salaries for faculty. No sense of urgency to care for faculty or staff. 
Fired or let walk over 50 people in past 18 months. 
Decision makers are hired who have little to no experience in higher ed. Then blame is passed on to existing faculty and staff when those new hires fail. 
Chancellor seems to be a snake oil salesman who wants to move the university hard to the theological right with little regard for anyone who gets in his way. Poor leadership skills.

review_title: OC is a great place to work!
pros: Incredible students and faculty members
cons: Pay scale and lack of salary increases

pros: Get to know and see many people
cons: low pay rate independent of experience

pros: OC works with their RA's and our busy schedules and we get free housing and counseling.
cons: The paychecks are about $68 twice a month while living on campus. It's hard to make that last very long, as groceries and gas takes up about $50 of the paycheck. Free housing is great but not having any money is hard.

pros: Great environment to work, the people are very nice and help full
cons: Not too competitive and it might take some adjsument

pros: You get school payed for and the environment is not very stressfull
cons: You don't get payed a lot compared to other places

pros: Great community with people who care
cons: More room for outreach and diversity

pros: Everyone is so friendly and patient to new guy.
cons: The pay rate is kind low.

pros: Opportunity to make the world a better place through a new genration of leaders.
cons: Higher eduation is a great field, but generally under funded.

pros: Small classes and good people

pros: Slow paced, peaceful, and very helpful to others.
cons: Crowded when there are events held on campus.

pros: Very nice co workers. Fun opportunities

job_title: Associate Professor, College Or University in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Good teamwork mentality. Fantastic executive leadership. Good mentor program.
cons: Average benefits for education industry, lower-paying compared to public universities.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
Good management 
Good buildings 
Good teachers
cons:
Some envious people
Too many changes in management

pros: Everyone is so helpful and knowledgable. Teachers are fantastic and administration is aways trying to make it best for students
cons: No cons. I really liked studying in OC

pros: This job is flexible with class schedules, easy, and pays well.
cons: I have no cons to provide.

pros: Progressive employer with great benefits and a more paid leave and holidays than any of my friends at other schools and way more than friends in other kinds of jobs. Faculty, staff and administration who care about students and about each other make OC a great place to work. Administrators strive to make campus environment family friendly and inclusive of diverse ideas and backgrounds.  Top management listens to employees and makes policy adjustments to improve conditions for work. OC also provides me fun and rewarding work. I get to see so many lives improved on a daily basis and to witness super-talented students, faculty, staff and visitors doing extraordinary things all the time.
cons: Financial challenges have limited compensation increases, but things are improving.  A lot of ambitious and talented people starting their careers here, so not all of us can be promoted as soon as we would hope. Still a great place to work and gain experience for a career in a lot of fields, not just higher education.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great family-friendly workplace. OC is home is so so so very accurate. OC is a place where you're loved and poured into personally and professionally, and you're given the opportunity to grow and pour into others, as well. You'll get out of OC what you put into it. It's not a perfect place, but then again, no place is. If you want to work for a place that transforms lives and strengthens God's kingdom, OC is a great place to be.
cons: OC is tuition dependent (like most private Christian universities) which means that small upticks or downfalls in enrollment can make a big impact on the university's bottom line. Everyone at OC is well-aware of this factor and steps are being taken to mitigate it, but it's still an issue. Like any organization, there are people at OC who don't fully buy into the mission and those individuals present special obstacles from time to time.

job_title: Secretary/Office Worker in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Professors are very friendly, the administrative support workers are awesome and fun to work with!  This was one of the best jobs I've ever had.  My boss was very understanding when school got in the way every once in a while, and it was easy to get along with everyone.
cons: Was only allowed to work 8 hours a week for minimum wage only.  I would've liked to work a little more in my down time between work and class and homework, but I'm also thankful for the hour limit when I got busy with school.

pros: Great Christian atmosphere and environment to work at.  There are many intangible perks built in such as lots of additional time off due throughout the year than you would typically see in other companies.  Management is very personable and engaging with the various level of employees throughout campus.
cons: Advancement can be limited due to the fact many people stay for a long time.  This simply speaks to how much people enjoy working there.  Compensation is most likely on the lower end, but this is off-set by many of the other intangible benefits that employees receive.

pros: Flexible schedule, missions focus, shorter school year, decent IT environment,
cons: Low pay, incompetence from too many staff, too many faculty who feel they don't have to work as hard because they make less $, very spoiled and whiny students, students with the amazing combination of being very spiritual and very selfish, What is the Academy of Leadership and Liability?

pros:
Some great people work there
Relaxed work environment 
Fun place
cons:
Always in budget crisis 
Favorites guides promotion not work production 
Leadership trying to protect themselves not their workers 
If your not part of the enter circle you will not advance
You can work very hard for very little usually not even a thank you. 
Says it is family but it is a very dysfunctional family

pros:
The people are very personable and helpful. 
Everyone I have met strives to be a servant leader which makes it a really great place to work.
cons: The salary is not very high since I am still in college. It is a Christian institution, so If you have a different perspective on spirituality, you might fit very well. But overall, it is a wonderful place.

review_title: Great place to get an education.
pros:
The staff truly care about providing the best education to the students possible. 
Very flexible and understanding about work hours and using time off.
The university does make an attempt to be supportive of its employees.
cons:
Few advancement opportunities.
Few raises or performance reviews.
Favoritism is visible in regards to upper management and departments.
Always seems to be in a budget crises.

pros: The students are generally sincere and hard-working; many professors are genuine and well-prepared.  Schedules can be flexible.  Focus on student involvement in missions commendable.
cons: Lack of communication within and between departments and administration.  In-fighting, favoritism, lack of courage and character on the part of those in positions to make decisions.  Very superficial, lip-service "intellectual" Christianity, lacking in depth and heart.

review_title: Positive higher education facility.  Great place to get a degree.  Affordable.  Academically challenging
pros: Great people working for university.  Family atmosphere.  Fairly supportive co-workers
cons:
Few advancement opportunities.
On staff side, raises or even performance reviews are few and far between.
Morale is poor.

pros: Great people and supportive of spiritual growth
cons:
Almost no advancements oppurtunities for support staff. 
Extremely low salary, often seen as part of the “mission” of working there. 
Bad benefits
Most of the staff is much older, usually working for the tuition discount for their kids.

job_title: Hardware Support Technician in Edmond, OK
pros: Incredibly flexible schedule for both school and extracurricular activities (like social club). Very laid back work environment, fun managers and staff.
cons: Low pay compared to other help desk jobs in the OKC area.  Only able to work a maximum of 20 hours a week, even as a part time student.

review_title: Great people, great place to work
pros: It's a great environment with great people.
cons: If working in other staff functions besides faculty, there is not necessarily a lot of room for upward mobility given limited management options.

review_title: Great place to work in higher education!
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Christian working environment that is relaxed yet professional.  Great benefits for employees.  Semesters are fast-paced which makes the time fly by.
cons: Low pay considering amount of work expected to perform; little employee development for staff, little advancement available.

review_title: Ups and Downs of working at OC
pros: The employees who work there are dedicated even though under compensated.
cons: I was laid off without any warning after years of dedicated service.  I was and still am traumatized by the poor way the layoff was handled.

job_title: Lead Customer Support Technician in Ardmore, OK

cons: I can't really think of any cons.

pros: I loved working at OC. It's a supportive Christian environment.
